metadata.commander_name: Generale di Corpo d'Armata Gastone Gambara

narrative.title: Xx Mobile Corps - 1941Q3
narrative.situation: Italian Mobile Armored Corps deployed in North Africa during 1941Q3.
narrative.objectives: Formal corps structure established 15 August 1941 with arrival of Trieste Division. Mobile armored and motorized reserve force for Panzerarmee Afrika. Primary Italian striking force coordinating with German Afrika Korps during Tobruk siege continuation and Gazala line establishment. Corps provided mobile defense and counter-attack capability.
narrative.axis_objective: Maintain defensive positions and inflict maximum casualties on Allied forces.
narrative.allied_objective: Advance and secure strategic objectives while minimizing casualties.

air_support.note: No theater air summary available for this quarter

special_rules: 198 tanks (growing Italian armored strength through Q3)
Two-division combined arms force (1 armored, 1 motorized)
Formal corps headquarters with dedicated staff (established 15 Aug 1941)
Mobile defense doctrine under Gambara's leadership
